choices.label: The bond dissociation energy between O atoms in <math alttext="O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is greater than the sum of the bond dissociation energies of the two <math alttext="O to H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>−</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math> bonds in <math alttext="H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
More bonds are formed in the products than are broken in the reactants.
The sum of the bond dissociation energies of the product molecules is equal to the sum of the bond dissociation energies of the reactant molecules.

content.answer: The sum of the bond dissociation energies of the product molecules is greater than the sum of the bond dissociation energies of the reactant molecules.
